description: This file defines the public API for temperature management in a hardware platform, including functions for retrieving temperature data, setting and getting temperature thresholds, and clock speed management. It includes enumeration types, function prototypes, and documentation comments.

methods.name: mfrGetTemperature
methods.description: Retrieves the current temperature states and values for the core and Wi-Fi chip. Returns status codes indicating success or errors related to uninitialized module, invalid parameters, or read failures.

methods.name: mfrSetTempThresholds
methods.description: Sets the high and critical temperature thresholds, stored in non-volatile memory, specified in degrees Celsius.

methods.name: mfrGetTempThresholds
methods.description: Retrieves the previously set high and critical temperature thresholds in degrees Celsius.

methods.name: mfrDetemineClockSpeeds
methods.description: Get recommended clock speeds for normal, scaled, and minimal states.

methods.name: mfrSetClockSpeed
methods.description: Sets the CPU clock speed to a specified value.

methods.name: mfrGetClockSpeed
methods.description: Gets the current CPU clock speed.

ctags.name: mfrTEMPERATURE_CRITICAL
ctags.pattern: /^    mfrTEMPERATURE_CRITICAL,    \/\/\/< Temp is critical, should trigger a thermal reset. $/

ctags.name: mfrTEMPERATURE_HIGH
ctags.pattern: /^    mfrTEMPERATURE_HIGH,        \/\/\/< Temp is high, but just a warning as device can still ope/

ctags.name: mfrTEMPERATURE_MAX
ctags.pattern: /^    mfrTEMPERATURE_MAX          \/\/\/< Out of range - required to be the last item of the enum.$/

ctags.name: mfrTEMPERATURE_NORMAL
ctags.pattern: /^    mfrTEMPERATURE_NORMAL = 0,  \/\/\/< Temp is within normal operating range. $/
